title: Obari
author: Obari
content: My question might seem odd but the truth is that I still have a long way to go on the forum and I've been trying to see if there is any automated way I can check to see my merits in the last 120 days or do I have to count it manually always ?This might not be the right thread for this but please pardon me and do well to let me know of the right thread So I can move it there.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: No need to manually count received merit. Just go to https://bpip.org, enter your name in search field and you will find bunch of info, including merit count in the last 30/90/120/150 days.And no worries about your question being odd as I also manually counted merit when I started applying for signature campaigns since I didn't know about the existence of bpip.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Additionally on Rikafip comment. You can also install bpip.org chrome plugin extension so that you can easily browse your merit counts in 30, 60, 120 day period on your merit page in the forum as default to save you time from going in Bpip.org and manually search it.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: I also recommend the BPIP extension. It has a lot of nice features, not only nice stats in your Merit page.It shows who is DT, it shows who is inactive or banned, it adds quick links to helper pages (ninjastic.space, loyce.club, bpip), it helps quoting from locked topics, it offers (if you want) even dark themes.It's of great help.Yes, it tells that it's beta and sometimes show inactives that have just became active again, but the glitches are small and few.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Coin_trader on February 23, 2023, 10:27:19 AMAdditionally on Rikafip comment. You can also install bpip.org chrome plugin extension so that you can easily browse your merit counts in 30, 60, 120 day period on your merit page in the forum as default to save you time from going in Bpip.org and manually search it.This is the simplest way, because all you need to do is click on the tab Profile -> Merit and there you can see your history of received and sent merits in the past 120 days.Quote from: Obari on February 23, 2023, 10:13:40 AMThis might not be the right thread for this but please pardon me and do well to let me know of the right thread So I can move it there.To me, it seems more appropriate for the Meta board, but it is not a problem to post it here either, considering that there are certainly other "beginners" who ask the same question.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: Ninjastic.space does not have table for users you sent merit too like BPIP.Your user page: Obari merits.I like Ninjastis.space because it has charts (Merits sent, Merits received last 3 months).

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: @Obari, as other members have mentioned, it is easiest to use the BPIP browser extension. Fore example, this is what I see when I want to check your merit statistics:Another option is to use the BPIP.org website directly: https://bpip.org/Profile?id=3504269

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Wow I want to thank everyone who has taken out their time to help a fellow and this is one thing I'm very certain about the forum which is the ability to always help someone who needs help and I'm really grateful for all those who took out their time to answer this question for me I'm grateful and the thread will be lock now and I hope to grow with you guys.
